frontMatter.title: Growth Hacker Plan
frontMatter.metaDescription: Explore low cost and smarter options to gain rapid market reach in a short time for growth through referrals and up-sales.

checklist.question: What are the means of your customers finding you (Awareness)?
checklist.expectation: Measurements of awareness effectiveness and cost of the each method.

checklist.question: What are the means of your customers onboarding to your product (Acquisition)?
checklist.expectation: Measurements of conversion rates and cost of the each method.

checklist.question: How quickly they get to the 'aha' moment with the product (Activation)?
checklist.expectation: Knowledge on the proportion of Customers who get their first win (value) through the product and time/effort taken to get there.

checklist.question: How many of your customers are returning to the product (Retention)?
checklist.expectation: Knowledge and measures of why some customers are not returning. How frequently the returning customers use the product. What are the features making the customers to return?

checklist.question: How many of the customers pay for the product and services (Revenue)?
checklist.expectation: What are the features your customers are willing to pay. How to increase the revenue per customer?

checklist.question: How many of your customers are active advocates (Referral)?
checklist.expectation: How many new awareness/acquisitions obtained through customer referrals? How can we improve that?

checklist.question: Do you measure your AAARRR as a funnel and know where the bottlenecks are?
checklist.expectation: Visualization of the funnel and conversion statistics at each funnel stage.

checklist.question: Do you maintain a list of experiments, their results and what tactics bring the most impact on your target market?
checklist.expectation: Innovation accounting done on the experiments to identify the most effective growth hacking tactics for your business.
